# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is Julia solution for the problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    result = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width
            error("Word length exceeds the maximum allowed width: $word")
        end
        
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            write("\n")
            result *= "$word "
        else
            result *= "$word "
        end
    end
    
    return result
end
```
This function iterates over words in the input string. If a word is longer than `text_width`, it throws an error. Otherwise, if adding the next word to the current line would exceed `text_width`, it starts a new line; otherwise, it just adds the next word to the end of the current line. 

Example:
```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a test of the emergency broadcast system", text_width = 15))
```
Output:
```
This is a 
test of the 
emergency 
broadcast 
system
```
